verses.verse: (For the choir director. A Psalm of David.) The heavens <S%H8064><s%> are telling <S%H5608><s%> of the glory <S%H9202><s%> of God; <S%H410><s%> And their expanse <S%H7549><s%> is declaring <S%H5046><s%> the work <S%H4639><s%> of His hands. <S%H3027><s%>
Day <S%H3117><s%> to day <S%H3117><s%> pours <S%H5042><s%> forth <S%H5042><s%> speech, <S%H561><s%> And night <S%H3915><s%> to night <S%H3915><s%> reveals <S%H2331><s%> knowledge. <S%H1847><s%>
There <S%H369><s%> is no <S%H369><s%> speech, <S%H561><s%> nor <S%H369><s%> are there <S%H369><s%> words; <S%H561><s%> Their voice <S%H6963><s%> is not heard. <S%H8085><s%>

Their line <S%H6957><s%> has gone <S%H3318><s%> out through all <S%H3605><s%> the earth, <S%H776><s%> And their utterances <S%H4405><s%> to the end <S%H7097><s%> of the world. <S%H8398><s%> In them He has placed <S%H7760><s%> a tent <S%H168><s%> for the sun, <S%H8121><s%>

Which <S%H1931><s%> is as a bridegroom <S%H2860><s%> coming <S%H3318><s%> out of his chamber; <S%H2646><s%> It rejoices <S%H7797><s%> as a strong <S%H1368><s%> man <S%H1368><s%> to run <S%H7323><s%> his course. <S%H734><s%>

Its rising <S%H4161><s%> is from one end <S%H7097><s%> of the heavens, <S%H8064><s%> And its circuit <S%H8622><s%> to the other end <S%H7098><s%> of them; And there <S%H369><s%> is nothing <S%H369><s%> hidden <S%H5641><s%> from its heat. <S%H2535><s%>

The law <S%H8451><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> is perfect, <S%H8549><s%> restoring <S%H7725><s%> the soul; <S%H5315><s%> The testimony <S%H5715><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> is sure, <S%H539><s%> making <S%H2449><s%> wise <S%H2449><s%> the simple. <S%H6612><s%>

The precepts <S%H6490><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> are right, <S%H3477><s%> rejoicing <S%H8055><s%> the heart; <S%H3820><s%> The commandment <S%H4687><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> is pure, <S%H1249><s%> enlightening <S%H215><s%> the eyes. <S%H5869><s%>

The fear <S%H3374><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> is clean, <S%H2889><s%> enduring <S%H5975><s%> forever; <S%H5703><s%> The judgments <S%H4941><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> are true; <S%H571><s%> they are righteous <S%H6663><s%> altogether. <S%H9191><s%>

They are more <S%H4480><s%> desirable <S%H2530><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> gold, <S%H2091><s%> yes, than <S%H4480><s%> much <S%H7227><s%> fine <S%H6337><s%> gold; <S%H6337><s%> Sweeter <S%H4966><s%> also than <S%H4480><s%> honey <S%H1706><s%> and the drippings <S%H5317><s%> of the honeycomb. <S%H6688><s%>
Moreover, <S%H1571><s%> by them Thy servant <S%H5650><s%> is warned; <S%H2094><s%> In keeping <S%H8104><s%> them there is great <S%H7227><s%> reward. <S%H6118><s%>
Who <S%H4310><s%> can discern <S%H995><s%> [his] errors <S%H7691><s%>? Acquit <S%H5352><s%> me of hidden <S%H5641><s%> [faults.]

Also <S%H1571><s%> keep <S%H2820><s%> back <S%H2820><s%> Thy servant <S%H5650><s%> from presumptuous <S%H2086><s%> [sins]; Let them not rule <S%H4910><s%> over me; Then <S%H227><s%> I shall be blameless, <S%H8552><s%> And I shall be acquitted <S%H5352><s%> of great <S%H7227><s%> transgression. <S%H6588><s%>

Let the words <S%H561><s%> of my mouth <S%H6310><s%> and the meditation <S%H1902><s%> of my heart <S%H3820><s%> Be acceptable <S%H7522><s%> in Thy sight, <S%H6440><s%> O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> my rock <S%H6697><s%> and my Redeemer. <S%H1350><s%>
